column4: have you been messing with user access rights? whats the kernel version on troubled os?.... did you compile it yourself? whats the file system on the flash disk?
no, i haven't except for adding my user to groups like audio, i'm using 8.04 with a 2.6.24-26 kernel
the stick has a fat filesystem and yes, i've rebuild the ubuntu kernel image but only the PAE option changed
everything else is the same
i can mount the sticks as root using mount on the command line
but i want it to happen automatically as on my notebook
ok\
i wonder how to debug this? where can i see message of something failing if i click on my stick from the places menu and nothing happens?
this kernel recompile you did a complete copy bar the added PAE support?
i've created my own "pae flavour" as some of the howtos in the net recommend
debug question a good one.... off top of head not sure
if i knew how to see the command that nautilus or the gnome panels tries to run
i could probably spot the error
but my first problem is that nautlis always detaches itself from the terminal and seems to have no debug option
start it with a terminal gksu nautilus and watch the terminal for output...
as root, it works strangely
maybe
when i do it as root i can see entries like "Jan 23 11:40:56 belana hald: mounted /dev/sdd1 on behalf of uid 0" in my syslog
but not if i do it as user
just for your information, gnome-mount -vbd seems to have the debug output
not there outda box...... but thank u.

hope ya find what ya need..... im worried because of the custom kernel and the adding of users to groups.... you have this trouble.... voids ya support warranty ;) its hard to know exactly what you have been up 2. sorry im not of more useful
no problem, i've found a workaround meanwhile
its somehow connected to the policy kit
